titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Early American Bookplates)
Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Early American Bookplates)
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Rino Landa

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:04

did.unittitle: Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Early American Bookplates)
did.abstract: The collection consists of early American bookplates commissioned by both individuals and institutions, as well as correspondence and ephemeral materials related to the collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Irene D. Andrews Pace, 1963, in memory of Dr. Edmund Andrews (Yale 1913) and his father, Dr. E. Wyllys Andrews.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Early American Bookplates), Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born Irene Greene Dwen, Mrs. Pace (1892-1962) was an avid bookplate collector from the early 1920s until 1962. In addition to over 150,000 plates in her collection, she also maintained a reference library related to bookplates, as well as heraldry and biographical research. Pace commissioned several hundred bookplates for herself. In 1936, she published Owners of Books: The Dissipations of a Collector .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of early American bookplates commissioned by both individuals and institutions, as well as correspondence and ephemera related to the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Bookplates - Individuals. II. Bookplates - Organizations, Institutions, and Businesses. III. Bookplates - Unidentified. IV. Correspondence and Ephemera. Within each series, bookplates are arranged alphabetically. Any correspondence or ephemeral materials relating to a specific bookplate are filed together with the bookplate.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: A collection of private bookplates arranged alphabetically by the patron's surname.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: A collection of various library, university, social organization, and business bookplates arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Chelmsford, Social Library of – Erasmus Hall Library
Farmington Monthly Library – Hartford Young Men's Institute
Hasty Pudding Library – Newport, First Social Library in
Newburyport Public Library – New York Social Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains bookplates that have no patron or artist information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains letters of correspondence and other materials without attached bookplates.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Correspondence is arranged alphabetically according to recipient.
